title: This DIYer Turned Everyday Items Into the Cutest Gumball Machine Ornament
text:
Key Points
- This viral DIY gumball machine ornament uses common household items for a sweet Christmas tree decoration.
- The items needed include clear plastic ball ornaments, mini gingerbread ornaments, mini disposable shot cups, a hot glue gun, soda can tabs and small candies.
- Teachers and parents praise its creativity, with one person saying, “I’m making these for my kindergarten class!”
If your Christmas tree could use a touch of sweetness this year, this easy DIY project might be your next weekend craft. Content creator and mom Laura Jeanne (@crafting.with.laura) recently shared her clever gumball machine ornament on Instagram, and it quickly went viral—earning more than 3.3 million views and more than 50K likes.
It’s easy to see why. Who could resist this adorable ornament? Not only does the ornament look cute, but it’s also affordable to make from everyday items you probably already have around the house. Plus, it takes just a few minutes to make. Whether you’re crafting with your kids, making teacher gifts or adding something fun to your own tree, this sweet DIY is sure to bring smiles all around.
Here’s how to make it.

Jessica Kaplan
What You’ll Need
The items needed to DIY your own gumball machine ornament include:
- Clear plastic ball ornaments (available at most craft stores or online)
- Mini gingerbread ornaments (Laura used ones from
Amazon) - 2-ounce mini disposable shot cups
- Hot glue gun and glue sticks
- Soda can tabs
- Small candies (Laura used holiday M&Ms)
How to Make It
1. Flip a mini shot cup upside down to create the gumball machine base.
2. Add hot glue to the bottom of the clear ornament and press it onto the upside-down cup. Hold it in place until it’s secure.
3. Glue a soda can tab to the front of the ornament just above the cup rim. It’ll look like the turn handle on a real gumball machine.
4. For a cute finishing touch, glue a mini gingerbread ornament right above the tab.
5. Fill the opening of the ornament with small candies. Laura used holiday-colored M&Ms, but you can use gummy worms, gumdrops, Skittles or any small candy of your choice.
6. Close the ornament securely, then tie a red or green ribbon at the top for a pop of color.
Why Everyone Loves It
Laura’s simple craft has captured hearts across social media, earning praise from teachers, parents and DIY lovers alike. One teacher commented on her post, “I’m making these for my kindergarten class!” while another wrote, “This is such a cute idea—I need to try it!”
With just a few supplies and a bit of creativity, Laura turned basic household items into something that looks like it came from a fancy boutique. It’s a small reminder that the best holiday decor doesn’t have to come with a big price tag.
